revised_title: Inhibitory Action of Heated Serum on Subsequent Phagocytosis
tldr: The author investigates the inhibitory effect of heated serum on subsequent phagocytosis after passing it through which Bacilli have been passed. The study demonstrates that heated serum exerts a marked inhibitory action on the opsonins of fresh normal serum, suggesting the presence of opsonic amboceptors in normal serum that inhibit phagocytosis.
